const CHUNK_SIZE = 16384

Detailed Description

ProcessPipes manages descriptors and pipes for the use of proc_open.

Member Function Documentation

ProcessPipes::close (  ) 

Closes file handles and pipes.

ProcessPipes::closeUnixPipes (  ) 

Closes Unix pipes.

Nothing happens in case file handles are used.

ProcessPipes::getDescriptors (  ) 

Returns an array of descriptors for the use of proc_open.

Returns:
array

ProcessPipes::getFiles (  ) 

Returns an array of filenames indexed by their related stream in case these pipes use temporary files.

Returns:
array

ProcessPipes::hasOpenHandles (  ) 

Returns if the current state has open file handles or pipes.

Returns:
bool

ProcessPipes::read ( $  blocking  ) 

Reads data in file handles and pipes.

Parameters:
bool $blocking Whether to use blocking calls or not.
Returns:
array An array of read data indexed by their fd.

ProcessPipes::readAndCloseHandles ( $  blocking  ) 

Reads data in file handles and pipes, closes them if EOF is reached.

Parameters:
bool $blocking Whether to use blocking calls or not.
Returns:
array An array of read data indexed by their fd.

ProcessPipes::unblock (  ) 

Sets non-blocking mode on pipes.

$  stdin 
)

Writes stdin data.
